content.description: Start on two wide sidepull crimps, and drop into a right hand crimp. Then climb straight up the technical face... (look for that undercling!) a committing last throw to a jug in order to avoid dabbing/crashing through the  tree. Crux is making the stab into the slot at mid height. Some use the thin undercling, others go big...  Absolutely classic.. Enjoy.
content.location: To the right of Enlightenment around the arete. obvious face climb on crimps and slots.

content.description: Adds two moves. Low start with right hand slopey hueco sidepull, and left hand hueco sidepull. Left foot either toe hook or heel-toe cam. Climb up the slightly overhung wall utilizing slopers, pockets, crimps and a second heel-toe cam. Cruxy top-out. Sometimes also known as "Crimson Flower"

Starts on a left hand 3 finger pocket (four for some) and a right hand slopey slot. Utilize either a hard to place heel-toe cam or a bad smear to get to an iron crimp feature. Slopers, sidepulls, and crimps lead you to a hard topout.
content.location: To the right of Michael Jordan, the leftmost line on the first boulder.

content.description: Dont know who put it up, and fairly certain it has never been repeated. Climb the water groove directly left of the tree, and to the right of trillium.
content.location: directly to the left of the tree.

content.description:
Line to the right of Undercling King. Start in front of a large tree. Climbs the obvious left angling feature. the moves to the top are relatively easy, then the heat comes,, watch out for that tree ;) Running with scissors... you're not SUPPOSED to do it.  

***EDIT*** 

  Since being posted, the tree has been removed and the landing cleaned... Scissorless Running
content.location: To the right of Undercling King

content.description: Sit Start as for Michael Jordan, pick your ass up and traverse rightwards into Crimson Flower via a somewhat cryptic sequence and finish as for Trillium.The irony won’t be lost on cultured individuals (such as those reading this no doubt) that Reptilian Shapeshifter is the BONAFIDE Trillium Sit Start, whereas Crimson Flower is merely a LOW start to Trillium, rather than being a true SIT as often described. Avoiding the dab plays into the difficulty a bit, but not as much as it might seem at first glance. All in all, this is a worthy goal for those who’re at the point where running laps on Trillium is child’s play, but who’ve long since realized that this gets them no closer to a send of the intimidating Michael Jordan. Real Ballers might even use this as a stepping stone to MJ...
content.protection: Pads. For the start you needn’t hardly any at all, for the end just use as many as you normally use for Trillium.
content.location: It’s the same start as Michael Jordan, the slopey blob thing near the bottom of the slopey runnel running up the face of the boulder.

content.description: Same start as Running with Scissors, but cut right when you reach the seam heading to the right side of the boulder.
content.location: To the right of Undercling King.

content.description: Begin on a sloper, pull a couple lock off moves, then cruzer at the top.
content.location: Left side of the face that Jungle Book is on.

content.description: Start directly to the left of Enlightenment. Stand Start on two holds at chest height. A right hand sidepull, pockety fingerlock thing, and a left hand pinch. Hard move going left to a pinch, go right to a sloper, then duckbill crimp, then top out. Two topouts are often done. If you traverse right into enlightenment, it feels morelike v6, but the original way stays straight, and avoids all the holds on enlightenment. This way probably clocks in around v7.
content.location: start to the right of a tree and left of Enlightenment

content.description: THE testipece of the Holy Boulders. Jason was shown this line when it was dubbed "fatty sloper action" and devoted his time to be rewarded the FA of the best line at the Holies. Start down and right on the arete jug and move up and left through horrible slopers to a hard heel hook or hop move at the lip. absolutely gorgeous climb on sticky holds with perfect Fontainebleau friction, and features.
content.location: to the left of Michael Jordan. the first, and rightmost line on this boulder.

content.description: The amazing looking sloper problem to the left of Crimson Flower. Sit Start down and right in the "Air Jordan" feature. Make a big move up and left and then work through the slopey feature to reach a bad right hand crimp. Make a huge dyno move off of this crimp to a hold over the lip. Hard, scary mantle.
content.location: to the left of Trillium/Crimson Flower.

content.description: Tall but doable. Start on a large undercling sidepull jug feature and work up and slightly right. Crux is a long move to a gaston from a small 2-3 finger right hand gaston. high as hell, proud.
content.location: when facing the jungle book arete, this climb will be up and right of you. You will see a large hueco on a face up the hill. This is the boulder you want. Head through the corridor to a a tall face, with a large jug undercling/sidepull feature at about 6 feet. This is kings high

content.description: Classic overhung arete madness on the leftside of the New Zero Boulder. start on the left of the arete on jugs climb up aways till the holds disappear then do a large, but static move to a sloper on the arete. Slot a toe-hook then match the sloper. Cut your feet and enjoy the ride. Stick the crazy swing and then campus the final moves to a hard but manageable topout. Absolutely hyper-classic
content.protection: many pads and spotters for crazy swing.
content.location: the arete to the left of the new zero

content.description: This is the first boulder you will come upon in the Illuminati sector. Climb the rounded arête utilizing slopers jugs as pinches. Sit start low and slightly right on arête with big feet. The crux is the topout. Enjoy
content.location: First obvious arête with slopey huecos and jugs. Down climb is on back of boulder

content.description:
One of the more popular areas at the holys, this collection of boulders offer classic moderates such as Enlightenment (V4) and Undercling King (V6) as well as rarely repeated but just as classic testpieces such as Michael Jordan (V11/12) and The New Zero (V13) and a number of other great jems in between. Easy to find and a great area to spend a whole day session ing some of So Ills best boulders.  

**MANY OF THESE BOULDERS CAN BE SEEN HERE***https://vimeo.com/38856823 

vimeo.com/63945016
